summary: After the Civil War, the U.S. entered treaties with the Cherokee, Chickasaw, Choctaw, Muscogee (Creek), and Seminole Nations that abolished slavery in the Tribes. The formerly enslaved people living among these Tribes are known as the “Freedmen.” Freedmen descendants are eligible to enroll as citizens in some of these Tribes. Once enrolled, they can access certain federal services meant for Tribes and their citizens, such...
title: Tribal Programs: Information on Freedmen Descendants of the Five Tribes
